segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 5
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 5

segments.pli: 4. Sumanavagga
segments.en: 4. With Sumanā

segments.pli: 34. Sīhasenāpatisutta
segments.en: 34. With General Sīha

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā vesāliyaṃ viharati mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyaṃ.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.

segments.pli: Atha kho sīho senāpati yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho sīho senāpati bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then General Sīha went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and asked him,

segments.pli: “sakkā nu kho, bhante, bhagavā sandiṭṭhikaṃ dānaphalaṃ paññāpetun”ti?
segments.en: “Sir, can you point out a fruit of giving that’s apparent in the present life?”

segments.pli: “Sakkā, sīhā”ti bhagavā avoca:
segments.en: “I can, Sīha,” said the Buddha.

segments.pli: “dāyako, sīha, dānapati bahuno janassa piyo hoti manāpo.
segments.en: “A giver, a donor is dear and beloved to many people.

segments.pli: Yampi, sīha, dāyako dānapati bahuno janassa piyo hoti manāpo, idampi sandiṭṭhikaṃ dānaphalaṃ.
segments.en: This is a fruit of giving that’s apparent in the present life.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, sīha, dāyakaṃ dānapatiṃ santo sappurisā bhajanti.
segments.en: Furthermore, good people associate with a giver.

segments.pli: Yampi, sīha, dāyakaṃ dānapatiṃ santo sappurisā bhajanti, idampi sandiṭṭhikaṃ dānaphalaṃ.
segments.en: This is another fruit of giving that’s apparent in the present life.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, sīha, dāyakassa dānapatino kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggacchati.
segments.en: Furthermore, a giver gains a good reputation.

segments.pli: Yampi, sīha, dāyakassa dānapatino kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggacchati, idampi sandiṭṭhikaṃ dānaphalaṃ.
segments.en: This is another fruit of giving that’s apparent in the present life.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, sīha, dāyako dānapati yaṃ yadeva parisaṃ upasaṅkamati—yadi khattiyaparisaṃ yadi brāhmaṇaparisaṃ yadi gahapatiparisaṃ yadi samaṇaparisaṃ—visārado upasaṅkamati amaṅkubhūto.
segments.en: Furthermore, a giver enters any kind of assembly bold and assured, whether it’s an assembly of aristocrats, brahmins, householders, or ascetics.

segments.pli: Yampi, sīha, dāyako dānapati yaṃ yadeva parisaṃ upasaṅkamati—yadi khattiyaparisaṃ yadi brāhmaṇaparisaṃ yadi gahapatiparisaṃ yadi samaṇaparisaṃ—visārado upasaṅkamati amaṅkubhūto, idampi sandiṭṭhikaṃ dānaphalaṃ.
segments.en: This is another fruit of giving that’s apparent in the present life.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, sīha, dāyako dānapati kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjati.
segments.en: Furthermore, when a giver’s body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.

segments.pli: Yampi, sīha, dāyako dānapati kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjati, idaṃ samparāyikaṃ dānaphalan”ti.
segments.en: This is a fruit of giving to do with lives to come.”

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutte, sīho senāpati bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When he said this, General Sīha said to the Buddha,

segments.pli: “yānimāni, bhante, bhagavatā cattāri sandiṭṭhikāni dānaphalāni akkhātāni, nāhaṃ ettha bhagavato saddhāya gacchāmi; ahaṃ petāni jānāmi.
segments.en: “When it comes to those four fruits of giving that are apparent in the present life, I don’t have to rely on faith in the Buddha, for I know them too.

segments.pli: Ahaṃ, bhante, dāyako dānapati bahuno janassa piyo manāpo.
segments.en: I’m a giver, a donor, and am dear and beloved to many people.

segments.pli: Ahaṃ, bhante, dāyako dānapati; maṃ santo sappurisā bhajanti.
segments.en: I’m a giver, and good people associate with me.

segments.pli: Ahaṃ, bhante, dāyako dānapati; mayhaṃ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato: ‘sīho senāpati dāyako kārako saṅghupaṭṭhāko’ti.
segments.en: I’m a giver, and I have this good reputation: ‘General Sīha gives, serves, and attends on the Saṅgha.’

segments.pli: Ahaṃ, bhante, dāyako dānapati yaṃ yadeva parisaṃ upasaṅkamāmi—yadi khattiyaparisaṃ yadi brāhmaṇaparisaṃ yadi gahapatiparisaṃ yadi samaṇaparisaṃ—visārado upasaṅkamāmi amaṅkubhūto.
segments.en: I’m a giver, and I enter any kind of assembly bold and assured, whether it’s an assembly of aristocrats, brahmins, householders, or ascetics.

segments.pli: Yānimāni, bhante, bhagavatā cattāri sandiṭṭhikāni dānaphalāni akkhātāni, nāhaṃ ettha bhagavato saddhāya gacchāmi; ahaṃ petāni jānāmi.
segments.en: When it comes to these four fruits of giving that are apparent in the present life, I don’t have to rely on faith in the Buddha, for I know them too.

segments.pli: Yañca kho maṃ, bhante, bhagavā evamāha:
segments.en: But when the Buddha says:

segments.pli: ‘dāyako, sīha, dānapati kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjatī’ti, etāhaṃ na jānāmi; ettha ca panāhaṃ bhagavato saddhāya gacchāmī”ti.
segments.en: ‘When a giver’s body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.’ I don’t know this, so I have to rely on faith in the Buddha.”

segments.pli: “Evametaṃ, sīha, evametaṃ, sīha.
segments.en: “That’s so true, Sīha! That’s so true!

segments.pli: Dāyako dānapati kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjatīti.
segments.en: When a giver’s body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.

segments.pli: Dadaṃ piyo hoti bhajanti naṃ bahū,
segments.en: Giving, you’re loved and befriended by many people.

segments.pli: Kittiñca pappoti yaso ca vaḍḍhati;
segments.en: You get a good reputation, and your fame grows.

segments.pli: Amaṅkubhūto parisaṃ vigāhati,
segments.en: A generous man enters an assembly

segments.pli: Visārado hoti naro amaccharī.
segments.en: bold and assured.

segments.pli: Tasmā hi dānāni dadanti paṇḍitā,
segments.en: So an astute person, seeking happiness, would give gifts,

segments.pli: Vineyya maccheramalaṃ sukhesino;
segments.en: having driven out the stain of stinginess.

segments.pli: Te dīgharattaṃ tidive patiṭṭhitā,
segments.en: They live long in the heaven of the Three and Thirty,

segments.pli: Devānaṃ sahabyagatā ramanti te.
segments.en: enjoying the company of the gods.

segments.pli: Katāvakāsā katakusalā ito cutā,
segments.en: Having taken the opportunity to do good, when they pass from here

segments.pli: Sayaṃpabhā anuvicaranti nandanaṃ;
segments.en: they wander radiant in the Garden of Delight.

segments.pli: Te tattha nandanti ramanti modare,
segments.en: There they delight, rejoice, and enjoy themselves,

segments.pli: Samappitā kāmaguṇehi pañcahi;
segments.en: provided with the five kinds of sensual stimulation.

segments.pli: Katvāna vākyaṃ asitassa tādino,
segments.en: Doing what the unattached, the poised one says,

segments.pli: Ramanti sagge sugatassa sāvakā”ti.
segments.en: disciples of the Holy One rejoice in heaven.”

segments.pli: Catutthaṃ.

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī,…

suttaplex.blurb: The Buddha teaches General Sīha the benefits which he can see for himself in this life, and those in the next life, which he must take on faith.
